content.question: A researcher conducted a study investigating the effect of computer screen time on a personâ€™s amount of <math alttext="R E M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>REM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sleep. The researcher randomly assigned 100 people into four groups. The first group was given 2 hours of computer screen time each day, the second group was given 4 hours each day, the third group was given 6 hours each day, and the fourth group was given 8 hours each day. The study was conducted for one week, and the amount of <math alttext="R E M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>REM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sleep for each person was measured. What is the explanatory variable in the study?

choices.label: The amount of <math alttext="R E M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>REM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sleep
The amount of computer screen time
The four groups in the study
There is no explanatory variable because the study is observational.

content.answer: The amount of computer screen time
